theory_metadata.source_work: Rediscovering Institutions (March & Olsen); The New Institutionalism in Organizational Analysis (DiMaggio & Powell)
theory_metadata.original_purpose: Explain how institutions shape behavior through rules, norms, and taken-for-granted practices rather than just individual preferences

telos.primary_purpose: Explain behavior and outcomes through institutional constraints, norms, and logics that shape what actors consider appropriate and possible
secondary_purposes: Analyze institutional persistence and change processes
Explain isomorphism and convergence in organizational forms
Understand legitimacy and appropriateness in decision-making
Model path dependence and institutional lock-in effects
telos.theoretical_scope: Institutional influence on individual and organizational behavior
telos.domain_applicability: Organizational statements, policy documents, institutional communications, procedural discussions, legitimacy claims

classification.tier_justification: Explains behavior through institutional logics and predicts outcomes based on institutional constraints and isomorphic pressures

institutions.definition: Stable, valued, recurring patterns of behavior including rules, norms, and taken-for-granted practices

institutional_logics.definition: Organizing principles that provide meaning systems and behavioral guidelines for institutional action

actors.definition: Individual and organizational entities embedded within and constrained by institutional contexts

institutional_environments.definition: Broader contexts that create pressures for institutional conformity and legitimacy

regulative_pillar.definition: Formal rules, laws, and sanctions that constrain and regularize behavior

normative_pillar.definition: Values, norms, and role expectations that create social obligations

cultural_cognitive_pillar.definition: Shared beliefs, mental models, and taken-for-granted assumptions

institutionalization.definition: Process by which practices become taken-for-granted and legitimate

isomorphism.definition: Process by which organizations become similar in form and practice

institutional_change.definition: Process by which institutions are modified or replaced

logic_of_appropriateness.definition: Behavior driven by institutional rules about what is appropriate in given situations

logic_of_consequentiality.definition: Behavior driven by anticipated consequences and utility maximization
logic_of_consequentiality.institutional_modification: Preferences and alternatives shaped by institutional context

step_1_applicability_assessment.description: Evaluate text suitability for institutional analysis

criteria.institutional_context_present: Clear organizational or institutional setting with established practices
criteria.legitimacy_concerns_evident: References to appropriateness, legitimacy, or institutional norms
criteria.rule_norm_references: Explicit or implicit references to institutional rules, norms, or procedures
criteria.institutional_logic_identifiable: Evidence of institutional reasoning and taken-for-granted assumptions

step_1_applicability_assessment.scoring: 0.0-1.0 scale based on presence and clarity of institutional elements

step_2_institution_identification.description: Identify relevant institutions and institutional contexts
institution_mapping: Extract explicit institutional references and contexts
Identify implicit institutional assumptions and frameworks
Categorize institutions by type and scope
institutional_characteristics: Determine formalization level (formal rules vs. informal norms)
Assess institutional scope (narrow practices vs. broad logics)
Evaluate institutional legitimacy and taken-for-granted status
Identify institutional boundaries and membership criteria

step_3_institutional_logic_analysis.description: Identify dominant and competing institutional logics
logic_extraction: Identify organizing principles and meaning systems
Extract assumptions about appropriate behavior and goals
Determine decision-making criteria and evaluation standards
Assess logic coherence and internal consistency
logic_competition: Identify competing or conflicting institutional logics
Assess relative dominance and influence of different logics
Evaluate logic compatibility and tension sources
Analyze logic hybridization and blending patterns

step_4_institutional_pillar_analysis.description: Analyze regulative, normative, and cultural-cognitive institutional elements
pillar_identification: Regulative: Identify rules, procedures, sanctions, legal requirements
Normative: Extract values, norms, role expectations, professional standards
Cultural-Cognitive: Identify assumptions, categories, mental models, scripts
pillar_assessment: Evaluate relative strength and prominence of each pillar
Assess pillar alignment and mutual reinforcement
Determine pillar stability and change potential

step_5_behavioral_logic_identification.description: Identify whether behavior follows logic of appropriateness or consequentiality
logic_analysis: Logic of Appropriateness: Identify rule-following and role-appropriate behavior
Logic of Consequentiality: Identify utility-maximizing and strategic behavior
Mixed Logics: Identify situations combining both approaches
Logic Switching: Identify conditions triggering different behavioral logics

step_1_institutional_constraint_analysis.description: Analyze how institutions constrain and enable actor behavior
constraint_analysis: Identify behavioral limitations imposed by institutional rules and norms
Assess opportunity structures created by institutional arrangements
Evaluate actor agency within institutional constraints
Analyze institutional empowerment and resource provision

step_2_legitimacy_and_appropriateness_as.description: Evaluate how institutional legitimacy and appropriateness shape behavior
legitimacy_analysis: Identify legitimacy claims and appropriateness assertions
Assess institutional support for different behaviors and decisions
Analyze audience expectations and institutional accountability

step_3_institutional_change_analysis.description: Analyze institutional persistence and change dynamics
change_analysis: Identify sources of institutional stability and inertia
Assess pressures for institutional change and adaptation
Evaluate change mechanisms (incremental, radical, conversion, layering)
Predict institutional evolution trajectories and outcomes

step_4_isomorphism_and_diffusion_assessm.description: Analyze institutional convergence and practice diffusion
isomorphism_analysis: Analyze diffusion mechanisms and adoption patterns

internal_consistency.institution_identification_coherence: Institutions properly identified with clear boundaries and characteristics
internal_consistency.logic_analysis_thoroughness: Comprehensive identification of institutional logics and their implications
internal_consistency.pillar_assessment_completeness: Systematic analysis of regulative, normative, and cultural-cognitive elements
internal_consistency.behavioral_logic_determination: Clear identification of appropriateness vs. consequentiality patterns

theoretical_fidelity.march_olsen_framework_compliance: Adherence to institutional theory's core concepts and mechanisms
theoretical_fidelity.logic_of_appropriateness_emphasis: Focus on rule-following and institutionally appropriate behavior
theoretical_fidelity.institutional_embeddedness_recognition: Acknowledgment of actor embeddedness in institutional contexts
theoretical_fidelity.historical_path_dependence_consideration: Attention to historical development and path-dependent processes

empirical_validation.institutional_element_identification_acc: Valid extraction of rules, norms, and taken-for-granted practices
empirical_validation.logic_assessment_validity: Accurate identification of organizing principles and meaning systems
empirical_validation.constraint_analysis_realism: Realistic evaluation of institutional limitations and opportunities
empirical_validation.change_dynamic_characterization: Valid description of institutional persistence and change processes

predictive_validation.behavior_prediction_accuracy: Valid prediction of institutionally constrained and enabled behaviors
predictive_validation.legitimacy_outcome_forecasting: Accurate prediction of legitimacy consequences for different actions
predictive_validation.institutional_evolution_prediction: Valid prediction of institutional change and stability patterns
predictive_validation.isomorphism_anticipation: Accurate prediction of convergence and diffusion outcomes
